Я был приятно удивлен что нашел такую версию HL, но увы это продлилось не долго...
Первое что я увидел как и многие кто начинал игру это то что профессор в комнате перед камерой испытаний сидит не в кресле, а левитирует словно йог... ничего подумал я оказии иногда случаются
Но нет дальше был баг с хедкрабами которые застревали в колбах
Потом были ляпы с рассинхронизацией действий игрока и противников, например первый солдат который встречается в игре вместо того чтобы атаковать профессора и главного героя просто бежит мимо них и только потом начинает огонь.
Также несколько раз я мог спокойно стрелять в человека с чемоданчиком (что никак не было возможным в оригинальной игре)
И замена оружия тоже мне показалась неоднозначным ходом на мой взгляд m16 стреляет не так как это было с оригинальным mp5.

В общем посмотря на все это я расстроился.
Слеплено на скорую руку я бы так это назвал.

So I have 'heard' about half life for a very long time but never got around to playing it, but since I have a Vive and I want to get the VR half life game I bought HL and HL2 on sale. Basically this game is surprisingly engaging and just the right amount of challenging even for 2019! It took me 13 hours to complete and for $0.99 on sale i seriously got my money's worth out of it. If you haven't played this yet and looking for a good classic, this is an excellent choice!

As someone who is 19 years late to the Half-Life hype train, I felt torn as I had fun with my time with the game. But the game as a whole  just felt meh.  I can see how this game helped shaped the industry, but in terms of story telling this game was by far the most unexciting experience I have ever played.

Это худшее переиздание Half-life.
 
1) Графика-ужасна. Почему оружие выглядит так, как будто его смазали маслом? В темных помещениях (вентиляция, комната с выключателем и т.д) отражается какие-то белые квадраты...
2) Баги. Много багов. Почему эмм, тинтакли не наносят урон? Почему ракеты пролетают сквозь вертолет? Почему только несколько оружий наносят урон по Нихиланту? И это только маленькая часть. Почему так много багов? Непонятно...

 Если вы хотите пройти Half-life, то у вас есть 3 варианта
 1) Скачайте на тореннтах. Там стоит версия 2005 года без большинства багов.
 2) Купите оригинальный Half-life. 
 3) Купите Black mesa (если ваш ПК потянет)

Вывод: эта игра не достойна ваших денег...

A classic staple of first person shooters. You'll find a few bugs here and there but if you can get past that this is an incredible game and a fine entry into the Half-Life franchise. I would recommend Black Mesa though.

The influence of the game is undeniable, from the way it tells the story to the open yet linear style of first person shooting, this is a great game. But I came across so may sections that just frustrated me beyond belief, such as the bad platforming and so many cheap deaths that I had to constantly quick save the game just to get through it.

The best way i can describe this game is that its like going to boot camp, it was a great experience but I wouldn't want to go through it again. 

That being said everyone should play this, at least once.

I do not recommend this game. I only got it because of mounting it to gmod and improved graphics but the gameplay is terrible. either this is a patch or a source defect but jumping does not give you as much forward velocity as it does in regular half life so thats why bunny hopping works. my point is because of the decreased forward velocity when jumping I could make a jump and finish the game. also when I started I just played with console commands which is why I have so much playtime but for my first time playing the whole game I couldn't finish it.

One of the pivotal moments in this game is when you think the marines are coming to save everyone but then they shoot the scientist guy in front of you and then start shooting you. 
The botched AI in this version ends up ruining that scene, with the marine just kind of running up the stairs and past you instead while scientist guy runs in circles below. The AI generally only gets worse from there.

Half-Life: Source worked fine a couple of years ago.  Now it's screwed up. 

- my viewmodels aren't appearing
- the flashlight makes water planes appear
- some NPCs spawning is bugged (I saw a scientist cowering under 20 feet of water and the water monster was static at the surface)
- elevators may be off in wonderland if you go back to use them (I think it was during We Got Hostiles),
- the alien jump pads don't always trigger
- the music that plays is usually the wrong song

The original Half Life is great, though in my opinion the source engine makes it so much better, from the ragdoll physics, to the better lighting, I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to get into the Half Life series.

[h1] A disservice to Half-Life 1, so don't buy this version of the game [/h1] 

[b] Graphics [/b] 
It looks like the Black Mesa janitors were worked to death. By that, I mean a lot of the surfaces and weapons are too reflective. In the beginning of Office Complex, you enter a dark hallway with a red door on your right and faulty wiring on your left. In this game, the floor looks like a glazed donut.
There are several places in the original that look far better.

Something to note is that the toggle for the HD models seem to use FAN models instead of the ones Gearbox made. It's been this way since 2013 and those models still go uncredited.
[url=github.com/ValveSoftware/Source-1-Games/issues/2752] You can read about it here. [/url]

[b] Spec requirements [/b] 
If you can run Half-Life 2, you can run this with better performance since the detail is lower. Not that you'd want to run this.

[b] Difficulty [/b]
Nothing to note here, although all the chapters are available to enter in a menu in the vein of Half-Life 2, which is a nice quality of life improvement.
HOWEVER, all of the chapters are available instead of having to unlock them, meaning the chapters are kinda spoiled for you before you even start your playthrough.

[b] Bugs [/b]
There are entire series on YouTube, [url=developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Half-Life:_Source_Bugs] and even a page on the Valve Developer community [/url] about bugs in this game.
One of the first bugs you'll encounter is at the beginning of the game when you see a scientist levitating above his chair. The subtle storytelling of Half-Life is also ruined when [spoiler] the soldier runs up the stairs to kill you instead of the scientist in "We've Got Hostiles". The whole point of this scene was to show you that the military is NOT here to save you and your pals. They were sent here for clean up. Thanks, Half-Life: Source for screwing up the story. [/spoiler]
There's bugs in the game that can probably give people seizures. No joke.

[b] So, overall? [/b]
It seems this whole thing was a test to see how well you could port GoldSrc maps into Source. Then, they dumped this garbage out on the store for $9.99. Can you imagine buying this in 2004, excited to see Half-Life recreated with the graphics of the sequel? Some people weren't as fortunate and bought the game expecting this. It's the ENTIRE reason Black Mesa exists in the first place.

I recommend this ONLY for Garry's Mod mounting. If mounting in Garry's Mod didn't exist, I would highly suggest this garbage be delisted.
